Because they sent me this email today and
it's like June 8.

I have around two weeks at the most to expedite
this Chinese visa.

Now the things about Chinese visas when you're
getting them in America.

Unless you're living in the state where they
have the Chinese embassy,. then you need to

find a way to hand-deliver your passport to
the embassy.
Hand-deliver.
Which means a courier service.
Which means extra money.

This is probably a really big reason why I've
not traveled to China yet.

Although the visas, when you finally get them,
they have multiple entries and they last for
like 10 years.
So it's worthwhile.

It's just I've probably been lazy about getting
it.
So there's things I need to prepare for.

What's been helpful is the tourism board sent
us a few notes to help us plan our packing.

Cultural taboos,. clothing, climates, conversions
and stuff like that.

Cause China is a communist country, accessing
internet will be an issue.

For those of you who didn't know, Chine has
a huge wall.

No in and out of Googlling, no Facebook no
social media.

In order to get through some of that, I've
done some research as backup and I have a
handful of recommended VPN providers.
I think VPN is Virtual Private Network.

I put the word out to expat friends in China
and travel bloggers and
I have three-- Witopia, Express VPN, VYPRVPN.
Those are generally paid services.

But there's one free one for your mobile called
Betternet.
